intro: Hadrolaelia mantiqueirae, commonly known as the Mantiqueira orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to Brazil. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in mountainous regions with rich, well-drained soil. Its botanical features include a sympodial growth habit and specialized roots adapted for nutrient absorption. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a critically endangered species.
